0.user_question: Let $P(x)$ be a monic polynomial of degree 3.  Suppose that $P(x)$ has remainder $R(x)$ when it is divided by $(x - 1)(x - 4),$ and remainder $2R(x)$ when it is divided by $(x - 2)(x - 3).$  Given that $P(0) = 5,$ find $P(5).$

ost_step.1: Since $P(x)$ is a monic polynomial of degree 3, it can be written as $P(x) = x^3 + ax^2 + bx + c.$

0.user_question: Let $P(x)$ be a monic polynomial of degree 3.  Suppose that $P(x)$ has remainder $R(x)$ when it is divided by $(x - 1)(x - 4),$ and remainder $2R(x)$ when it is divided by $(x - 2)(x - 3).$  Given that $P(0) = 5,$ find $P(5).$

1.subquestion: Write down the coefficients of the polynomials $(x - 1)(x - 4)$ and $(x - 2)(x - 3)$.

subanswer.text: The coefficients of $(x - 1)(x - 4)$ are $1$ and $4$, and those of $(x - 2)(x - 3)$ are $1$ and $3$.

1.subquestion: What is the quotient when $P(x)$ is divided by $(x - 1)(x - 4)?$

subanswer.text: Let $Q(x)$ be the quotient. Then $P(x) = (x - 1)(x - 4)Q(x) + R(x)$. By the division algorithm, $Q(0) = -\dfrac{P(0)}{(1-1)(1-4)} = -\dfrac{5}{3}$, so $P(x) = (x - 1)(x - 4)\left(\dfrac{-5}{3}+Q(x)\right)+R(x)$. Setting $x=1$ or $x=4$ gives $P(1) = -\dfrac{5}{3}R(1)$ and $P(4) = -\dfrac{5}{3}R(4)$, respectively. The answers are $-\dfrac{5}{3}R(1)$ and $-\dfrac{5}{3}R(4)$.
